resources:
GreenFoodChallenge Diet Eco Eating User Pledge
//Strings for Eco Meat eater Low Meat Only Fish Vegetarian Vegan Better CO2e than current Diet Please enter your diet in Eating Habits Page.
After that, You can chose the diets above.
Diet with same overall meat proportions, but different proportions of each meat type.
75% of beef proportions to pork
50% of new pork proportions to chicken 
25% of new chicken proportions to fish.
Diet with lowered proportions of overall meat. 100% of beef proportions moved to pork 
75% of new pork proportions moved to chicken 
50% of new chicken proportions moved to fish and eggs (25/75) 
25% of each of new fish and eggs proportions go to beans and veg (50/50).
Diet with lower overall meat and fish being only meat. 100% of all meat but fish get split
 
(40/25/25/10) fish, eggs, beans, and veg.
Diet with no meat. 100% of all beef, pork, chicken, and fish gets split 
(40/40/20) with eggs, beans and veg.
Diet with no meat or eggs. 100% of all meats and eggs gets split 
(80/20) with beans and veg.
About 	The reason we made this app is to help people plan new, eco friendly diets in hopes of reducing greenhouse gas emissions and meeting Metro Vancouver's goal of becoming the greenest city in the world by 2020. 

What Contributes to Greenhouse Gases? 

	Greenhouse gases are measured in CO2e (or CO2 equivalents) and there are many CO2e contributors. Most people are aware of contributors such as burning fuel and natural gas, but it comes as a surprise to many that food production and transportation (livestock in particular) accounts for 20%% of a person's greenhouse gas emissions! 

	What Can We Do? 

	We can be more aware of what we eat and change our diets to reduce greenhouse gas emissions, and it does not even have to be an extreme dietary change. If people in the Metro Vancouver area reduced their beef/lamb consumption by 20% and replaced it with chicken, we could save up to 1 million tonnes of CO2e per year! 

	Where Does the Green Food Challenge Come In? 

	The Green Food Challenge aims to reduce our individual and collective carbon footprints by raising awareness and making it easy for users to adopt more environmentally friendly, lower carbon diets. Simply enter an estimate of how much meat and alternatives you eat and the app will make new, eco-friendly diets for you to choose from. It's that easy, so what are you waiting for? 

	Let's get saving!
// Strings for EatingHabitsFragment Please enter at least one valid amount 

	 
	This diet will produce %1$.2f tonnes/year of CO2e which is equivalent to burning %2$.2f litres of gasoline. Think about how much gas you use to commute! 

	Compared to the regional average of %3$.2f tonnes/year per capita, this diet produces %4$s. 

	If everyone in your area ate like this for a year, they would produce approximately %5$d tonnes of C02e which is %6$s than the current %7$d tonnes. 

	As you can see these numbers are massive! Lets look at the Eco page to see how changing our diet can affect these numbers.
%1$d people and %2$.2f tonnes of C02e have been pledged in total.
This is equivalent to %3$.2f barrels of gasoline.

The average C02e saved per person is %4$.2f tonnes.
// Strings for calculator results This is the proportion of foods in your diet by weight. The total C02e emissions from your diet is %1.2f tonnes per year! This is equivalent to burning %2.2f barrels of gasoline. 

Shown below is the total C02e footprint for each food in your diet. Every food has its own C02e footprint which is why the two pie charts above do not seem to be consistent. 

It is important to note that for most people, their diet contributes to about 20 percent of their total C02e emissions. Your diet produces %1$s than the Metro Vancouver average of %2$.2f tonnes for food.
